message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CL. 

The paper proposes a neural-network based approach for semantic segmentation of 3D shapes, which involves processing 3D augmented views of the shape using a Convolutional Neural Network and postprocessing the results using Conditional Random Fields. This involves techniques from computer vision (cs.CV) and computer graphics (cs.GR), as well as machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) for the neural network approach. The postprocessing step involves contextual information, which could also involve natural language processing (cs.CL).
